example.code:
PS C:\>Get-EC2Address
InstanceId : PublicIp : 192.0.2.1 AllocationId : AssociationId : Domain : standard NetworkInterfaceId : NetworkInterfaceOwnerId : PrivateIpAddress :
example.description: Returns details of all your Elastic IP addresses.

This example request describes two specific Elastic IP addresses allocated to your account. Both addresses were created for instances in EC2-Classic, so you must specify them using their IP addresses.

example.code: # to specify more than one allocation id, use array syntax e.g. -AllocationId @( "eipalloc-08229861", "eipalloc-16892280" ) PS C:\>Get-EC2Address -AllocationId "eipalloc-08229861"
example.description: This example request describes two specific Elastic IP addresses allocated to your account. Both addresses were created for instances in EC2-Classic, so you must specify them using their IP addresses.

example.code:
PS C:\>$filter = New-Object Amazon.EC2.Model.Filter PS C:\>$filter.Name = "domain" PS C:\>$filter.Value = "vpc"
PS C:\>Get-EC2Address -Filter $filter
example.description: This example returns your Elastic IP addresses for EC2-VPC only. If you are using PowerShell v3 or higher, this can be expressed as 'Get-EC2Address -Filters @{ Name="domain";Value="vpc" }'.
